summary: This is a cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated February 5, 2019, transmitting a grand jury subpoena to Boles Schiller Flexner LLP. The letter requests the law firm to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of an official criminal investigation into a suspected felony.

persons.name: Silvio J. Mamo
persons.role: Person for whom a U.S. Department of Justice building is named
persons.context: The document's letterhead lists the address as 'The Silvio J. Mamo Building,' indicating a DOJ facility named after him.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to the law firm Boles Schiller Flexner LLP as part of an official criminal investigation into a suspected felony.

locations: Silvio J. Mamo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Boles Schiller Flexner LLP, 575 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: A federal grand jury investigation into a suspected felony was active as of February 5, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the recipient law firm to keep the subpoena confidential to avoid impeding the investigation.
The subpoena was issued to Boles Schiller Flexner LLP, a law firm.
The document is part of the Epstein case file, suggesting the investigation relates to Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.
The letter emphasizes the sensitivity of the investigation by asking for voluntary non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence.
